alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:39PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Randall, southeastern Oldham, eastern Deaf Smith and Potter Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Buffalo Lake, or 11 miles southeast of Hereford, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Dawn, Valley De Oro, Umbarger, Wildorado and Timbercreek Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
